oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bus depot, Nashville, Tenn., between 1935 and 1945
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A postcard of the Union Bus Terminal located at 517 Commerce Street in downtown Nashville, Tennessee. Built in the latter part of the 1930s, this bus terminal exemplified the art deco architecture style of the time period. According to city directories, this station housed several bus companies including Greyhound, Consolidated and Lewisburg lines. Several public transit riders wait on the corner for buses. Parked cars are lined up on the street outside of the building. This structure is no longer standing. Forms part of the Norton Postcard Collection. 1 postcard : col. ; 3.5 x 5.5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Union Bus Terminal (Nashville, Tenn.)
